candidates.name: Mark Dean
candidates.why_elect: I have an extensive background in environmental business. Educated at Waikato University, I taught for ten years before founding Naturally Native NZ Plants in Oropi. I have extensive governance experience, holding directorships, chairmanship of industry bodies, and Environmental Trusts.
candidates.why_stand: I believe the Western Bay is a great place to live and I feel we need to work to maintain this. I have had one term on council and I feel I have much more to offer. I would like to continue to serve the district.

candidates.name: John Evans
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in and around this community for most of my life. I believe in having conversations to hear as many points of view as possible. Then work through a solution (based in common sense and practicality) for the community.
candidates.why_stand: I am for change. I feel the time is right to elect younger representation, someone who is young enough to have great aspirations for our community and have the drive/energy to see the ideas to fruition.

candidates.name: Margaret Murray-Benge
candidates.why_elect: When people have an issue I like to visit them to understand it first hand, and then work with them to resolve the issue. I work with people and together we have and do make a difference.
candidates.why_stand: I am running because I believe we can do better than we are at the present. With the years of experience I have had in leadership roles in local government in Waimairi District Council, United council, Christchurch City and 15 years in Western Bay as Councillor. I am ready.

candidates.name: John Palmer
candidates.why_elect: I have lived in our community for 23 years, I am a chartered engineer who has had a career in local government both as an employee and a consultant and I want to continue to bring my experience to the council table and add value to the decision making.
candidates.why_stand: My first term on council has been a learning experience and I am now seeking re-election and a desire to take a greater role in managing the issues of growth and affordability that our fast growing district is facing.
